E20.title: E20 MS
E20.subTitle: Motor Fuel
E20.description: Motor Spirit (also known as Motor Gasoline) is a distillate fraction, normally boiling within the range 30°C to 210°C. It is a complex mixture composed of relatively volatile hydrocarbons (alkanes, alkenes and aromatics with typical carbon chain length of C5 to C10) that vary widely in their physical and chemical properties.

specifications.property: Reid vapour pressure (RVP) at 37.8 °C, kPa, Max
Copper strip corrosion (3 h at 50 °C), Max
Water tolerance of motor gasoline-alcohol blends, temperature for phase separation, °C, Max

specifications.value: 15 (Ethers containing 5 or more ‘C’ atoms per molecule such as MTBE, ETBE or TAME) / Not permitted (Any other oxygenates)

E20.appData: Primarily used in transportation (Cars, Sport Utility Vehicles, Motorcycles and Scooters).

HSD.title: High Speed Diesel
HSD.subTitle: Motor Fuel
HSD.description: High-Speed Diesel (HSD), also known as Automotive Diesel Fuel, is produced from the fractional distillation of crude oil between 200°C and 400°C resulting in a mixture of carbon chains and is composed of saturated hydrocarbons and aromatic hydrocarbons.

specifications.property: Total Acid Number (TAN), mg of KOH/g, Max
Carbon residue (Ramsbottom or micro) on 10 % residue, % by mass, Max
Copper strip corrosion (3 h at 50 °C), Max
Oxidation stability (for diesel fuel having FAME content of above 2 percent v/v), hours, Min
Oxidation stability (for diesel fuel having FAME content of above 2 percent v/v), minutes, Min
Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbon (PAH), % by mass, Max
Lubricity, wear scar diameter (wsd) at 60 ºC, μm, Max

HSD.appData: HSD is commonly used as a fuel in medium and high-speed compression ignition engine in commercial vehicle, stationery diesel engines, locomotive and pumps etc. It is also used as fuel in power generation (DG sets), agriculture and construction machinery.

Ethanol.title: Ethanol
Ethanol.subTitle: FUEL ADDITIVE FOR MS
Ethanol.description: Ethanol meant for E20 blending having purity of min. 99.5% and other components including water max. 0.5%. Anhydrous Ethanol is known as Ethyl Alcohol, is a clear, colourless and homogenous liquid with high purity, also known as Absolute Alcohol. Anhydrous Ethanol is categorized into 1G and 2G, based on its source of raw material used. 1G Ethanol produced from raw materials viz. sugarcane juice, molasses, damaged food grains. 2G Ethanol are generally made from biomass. 1G Ethanol is produced by subsidiary unit HPCL-Biofuel Ltd.

specifications.property: Higher saturated alcohols (C3-C5), percent, v/v, Max
Residue on evaporation, percent by mass, Max
Aldehyde (as CH3 CHO) content, mg/l, Max

Ethanol.appData: Ethanol is an environment friendly fuel used for blending with Motor Spirit (MS).

Kerosene.title: Kerosene
Kerosene.subTitle: Fuel
Kerosene.description: Kerosene is distillate fractions of crude oil in the boiling range of 150-250°C. It is a complex mixture of hydrocarbons from crude oil distillation, primarily containing alkanes (paraffins), cycloalkanes (naphthenes) and some aromatics like alkylbenzenes.

specifications.property: Char Value, mg/kg of oil consumed, Max
Colour Saybolt (in case of undyed Kerosene), Min
Colour Visual (in case of dyed Kerosene)
Copper strip corrosion (3 h at 50 °C), Max

specifications.value: Not limited, but to be reported

specifications.property: Distillation Percent recovered below 200°C, percent (v/v), Min
Total Sulphur Content, percent, m/m, Max

Kerosene.appData:
Kerosene is used in many industrial applications like heating, cleaning and as thinner. It is also used for lighting lamps in areas where electricity is not available. 
Kerosene with ultra-low sulfur content upto 10 mg/kg is used as pipeline compatible plug material (PCK) in multi-product pipeline operations in Petroleum Industry. Chemical industry uses kerosene as a petroleum solvent and in pesticide industry.
Kerosene.industrial: Domestic Use, Petroleum Industry. Chemical Industry & Pesticide industry

ATF.title: Aviation Turbine Fuel A-1
ATF.subTitle: AVIATION FUEL
ATF.description: Aviation Turbine Fuel is a colorless, combustible, straight-run petroleum distillate, kerosene-based fuel. Kerosene makes up the majority of Jet A-1, with trace amounts of additives.

specifications.value: ATF (Jet A-1) (Aviation Turbine Fuel Jet A-1)

specifications.property: Particulate contamination at point of manufacture, mg/l, Max
Particulate, cumulative channel particle counts at point of manufacture
specifications.value: ≥ 4 μm(c): Report, ≥6 μm(c): Report, ≥14 μm(c): Report, ≥21 μm(c): Report, ≥25 μm(c): Report, ≥30 μm(c): Report

specifications.property: Refining components at the point of manufacture
specifications.value: Non Hydro processed Components: Report, Mildly Hydro processed Components: Report, Severely Hydro processed Components: Report, Synthetic Components: Report

specifications.property: Silver strip corrosion (4 h at 50 °C), Max
Thermal Stability, JFTOT at Control Temperature of 260°C
specifications.value: Filter pressure differential, mm Hg, Max 25; Tube rating visual (VTR) <3, No ‘Peacock’ or ‘Abnormal’ OR Annex C ITR/Annex D ETR, average over area 2.5 mm², Max 85

specifications.property: Micro-separometer rating at point of manufacture
specifications.value: MSEP without SDA, Min 85; MSEP with SDA, Min 70

specifications.property: Fatty Acid Methyl Ester, mg/kg, Max

ATF.appData: ATF Jet A-1 is used for aircrafts (Military jets) and Civil Aviation sector worldwide. It is a higher quality fuel subjected to stringent Quality Control norms set by DGCA and DGAQA.

LAN.title: Low Aromatic Naphtha
LAN.subTitle: INDUSTRIAL FEEDSTOCK/FUEL
LAN.description: Petroleum naphtha is a complex mixture of hydrocarbons, primarily C5–C8 alkanes (paraffins), cycloparaffins, and aromatics, with specific compositions varying significantly based on the crude oil source and refining process. It contains higher percentage of paraffins and low percentage of aromatic hydrocarbons (such as benzene, toluene, and xylene). It also contains sulfur compounds.

specifications.property: Reid vapour pressure at 37.8 °C, kPa, Max
Total paraffins, percent by volume, Min
Naphthenes and aromatics, percent by volume

LAN.appData: Naphtha is used by refineries in blending of petroleum products, isomerization, reforming, and in the production of value-added products. Naphtha serves as a primary feedstock for the production of gasoline. It is also a crucial component in the manufacturing of various petrochemical products, including plastics, fertilizers, and synthetic fibres. Naphtha is a key raw material for the production of various plastics, including polyethylene (PE), polypropylene (PP), and polystyrene (PS).

HEXANE.title: FOOD GRADE HEXANE
HEXANE.subTitle: PROCESS SOLVENT
HEXANE.description: Food Grade Hexane is a highly purified petroleum distillate fraction that contains a high proportion of n-hexane with boiling range of 63 to 70°C. It is a clear colourless liquid with distinct odour, free from sediment, suspended matter and moisture.
HEXANE.appData: Food Grade Hexane is used in Food processing industry as a solvent to extract edible oils with minimum harmful residue to meet strict purity standards set by statutory bodies such as FSSAI. It is also used in Drug and Pharmaceuticals industry for drug extraction and as a cleaning agent.

1425.title: Solvent 1425
1425.subTitle: PROCESS SOLVENT
1425.description: Solvent 1425 is a petroleum-derived industrial solvent having a complex mixture of petroleum hydrocarbons that vary widely in their physical and chemical properties with boiling range between 50 - 120°C. Solvent 1425 is having strong solvency power due to its wide chemical composition. Solvent 1425 is having higher evaporation rate that improves efficiency of the solvent.

specifications.property: Aromatic content, percent by volume, Max
Residue on evaporation, mg/100 ml, Max

1425.appData: Solvent 1425 is a potent degreaser, effectively removing oil, grease, wax, and tar from various surfaces. It is commonly used in cleaning engines, parts and tools. Solvent 1425 finds application in the paint and coatings industry. It is used for diluting paints, varnishes, and lacquers to adjust viscosity and improve application. Solvent 1425 as a cleaning and degreasing agent in leather and rubber industry.

MTO.title: Mineral Turpentine Oil
MTO.subTitle: PROCESS SOLVENT
MTO.description: Solvent 2445, commonly referred to as MTO, is a petroleum-derived aliphatic hydrocarbon solvent obtained from the middle distillate/naphtha range. It is a water-white, highly volatile, low-viscosity solvent used extensively in paints, adhesives, and chemical industries. It has boiling range between 125 - 240°C.

specifications.property: Aromatic content, percent by volume, Max
Residue on evaporation, mg/100 ml, Max

MTO.appData: Solvent 2445's high solvency power, low toxicity, moderate evaporation rate, and inertness make it a valuable substance in various cleaning, degreasing, and dissolving processes. Its unique properties make it an essential component in the formulation of paints, adhesives, inks, and numerous other products.

FO.title: MV2 Grade
FO.subTitle: Industrial FUEL
FO.description: Fuel oil is a dark viscous residual fuels obtained by blending mainly heavier components from crude distillation unit. It is generally consisted of heavy petroleum product. Efficiency and type of fuel oil widely varies depending on kinematic viscosity and sulphur content.

specifications.value: Not limited, but to be reported

specifications.property: Density at 15°C kg/m³ or Relative density at 15.6/15.6°C
specifications.value: Not limited, but to be reported

specifications.property: Sulphur, total, percent by mass, Max
Water content, percent by volume, Max

FO.appData: Fuel oil is used as a backup fuel for power generation in facilities where a reliable power supply is crucial. It is used in thermal power plants for boiler start up. It serves as a contingency option during periods of fuel shortages or interruptions in primary fuel sources. Fuel oil is used in various industrial applications for heating purposes. Cement and Steel plants use fuel oil as a source of energy in furnaces for high heat processes.
FO.industrial: Power, Marine, Manufacturing (Steel, Cement, Glass, Ceramic Industries)

LDO.title: Heating Oil (LDO)
LDO.subTitle: INDUSTRIAL FUEL
LDO.description: Heating Oil also known as Light Diesel Oil (LDO) consists of medium length chains of hydrogen and carbon mainly alkanes, cycloalkanes, aromatics and oils. Basically, Heating oil is termed for medium commercial extracts from crude oil. It is either distilled or residual fraction of various oils that is extracted while distillation. It has a lower flash point compared to heavier Fuel Oil (FO), for easier ignition.

specifications.property: Carbon residue on whole samples, percent by mass, Max
Water content, percent by volume, Max

LDO.appData:
FLDO is known for its efficient combustion properties. This fuel is free flowing in nature. 
It finds extensive use in industries such as manufacturing, power generation, and heating systems. It is commonly used in boilers, furnaces, and other equipment that require a steady and controlled source of heat.

HFHSD.title: High Flash High Speed Diesel Distillate Marine Fuel
HFHSD.subTitle: MARINE FUEL
HFHSD.description: High Flash High Speed Diesel (HFHSD) is a special grade of diesel fuel with flash point (Min. 66°C) significantly higher than that of HSD (Min. 35°C). It consists of hydrocarbons with carbon numbers predominantly in the range of C9 to C28, with a boiling range of approximately 150°C to 400°C. It is produced by refining middle-distillate fractions to meet stringent safety and performance specifications IS 16731(ISO 8217).

specifications.value: High Flash High Speed Diesel Distillate Marine Fuel

specifications.property: Carbon residue (micro method on 10 % volume distillation residue), mass %, Max
Lubricity, corrected wear scar diameter (WSD) at 60 °C, μm, Max

HFHSD.appData: HFHSD is mainly manufactured for non-automotive applications. It is mainly applicable for marine use by Indian Navy, Merchant Ships, fishing vessels etc. where a high flash point diesel is required.

VLSFO.title: Very Low Sulfur Fuel Oil
VLSFO.subTitle: MARINE FUEL
VLSFO.description: VLSFO is a type of marine fuel that complies with the International Maritime Organization (IMO) – Marine Oil Pollution Control (MARPOL) regulations to reduce sulphur emissions from ships. It is generally blended from different refinery streams to achieve low sulfur levels while maintaining suitable viscosity and energy content for ship engines. VLSFO is a cleaner marine fuel with very low sulfur content (0.5% by wt. max./as per statutory norms) and prescribed limit of element content in fuel (Na, V, Al, Si, Ca, Zn, P).

specifications.property: Carbon residue – micro method, mass %, Max

VLSFO.appData: VLSFO is primarily used as a marine fuel in ships to comply with IMO regulations. VLSFO is used in various types of vessels, including container ships, bulk carriers, etc.

LSHS.title: Low Sulphur Heavy Stock
LSHS.subTitle: Industrial FUEL
LSHS.description: Low Sulphur Heavy Stock (LSHS) is a dense, viscous residual product from crude oil distillation, featuring a black, thick liquid form with Low Sulfur (Max. 1.8%) content as per customer requirement.

specifications.property: Density at 15 °C or Relative density at 15 °C
Sulphur, total, percent by mass, Max
Water content, percent by volume, Max

LSHS.appData: LSHS is used mainly in heavy industry, steel plants, and power plants as fuel. LSHS is mainly used in steel production and where the finished product to be heated are likely to get contaminated with sulfur.

VG-10.title: Paving Bitumen (VG10)
VG-10.subTitle: ROAD CONSTRUCTION MATERIAL
VG-10.description: Bitumen is obtained as the last residue in fractional distillation of crude petroleum. It is defined as a viscous liquid, or a solid, consisting essentially of complex mixture of hydrocarbons including high-molecular-weight compounds, such as asphaltenes, and lighter fractions, such as aromatics and saturates. It is substantially non-volatile and softens gradually when heated. It is black or brown in colour & possesses waterproofing and adhesive properties.

specifications.property: Penetration at 25°C, 100 g, 5 s, 0.1 mm, Min
Residue from rolling thin film oven test
specifications.value: Viscosity ratio at 60°C, Max 4.0; Ductility at 25°C, cm, Min 75

VG-10.appData: Paving bitumen is extensively used in the construction of roads, highways and airport tarmac.

VG-30.title: Paving Bitumen (VG30)
VG-30.subTitle: ROAD CONSTRUCTION MATERIAL
VG-30.description: Bitumen is obtained as the last residue in fractional distillation of crude petroleum. It is defined as a viscous liquid, or a solid, consisting essentially of complex mixture of hydrocarbons including high-molecular-weight compounds, such as asphaltenes, and lighter fractions, such as aromatics and saturates. It is substantially non-volatile and softens gradually when heated. It is black or brown in colour & possesses waterproofing and adhesive properties.

specifications.property: Penetration at 25°C, 100 g, 5 s, 0.1 mm, Min
Residue from rolling thin film oven test
specifications.value: Viscosity ratio at 60°C, Max 4.0; Ductility at 25°C, cm, Min 40

VG-30.appData: Paving bitumen is extensively used in the construction of roads, highways and airport tarmac.

VG-40.title: Paving Bitumen (VG40)
VG-40.subTitle: ROAD CONSTRUCTION MATERIAL
VG-40.description: Bitumen is obtained as the last residue in fractional distillation of crude petroleum. It is defined as a viscous liquid, or a solid, consisting essentially of complex mixture of hydrocarbons including high-molecular-weight compounds, such as asphaltenes, and lighter fractions, such as aromatics and saturates. It is substantially non-volatile and softens gradually when heated. It is black or brown in colour & possesses waterproofing and adhesive properties.

specifications.property: Penetration at 25°C, 100 g, 5 s, 0.1 mm, Min
Residue from rolling thin film oven test
specifications.value: Viscosity ratio at 60°C, Max 4.0; Ductility at 25°C, cm, Min 25

VG-40.appData: Paving bitumen is extensively used in the construction of roads, highways and airport tarmac.

150GR-1.title: 150 SN (GR I) LUBES
150GR-1.subTitle: Base Oil
150GR-1.description: Virgin Mineral base oil containing less than 90% saturates and/or greater than 0.03% sulphur with Viscosity Index greater than or equal to 80 and less than 120. Used for finished lubricants depending on the properties.
150GR-1.appData: Base oils are being used for finished lubricants depending on the properties.

500GR-1.title: 500 N (GR I)
500GR-1.subTitle: Base Oil
500GR-1.description: Virgin Mineral base oil containing less than 90% saturates and/or greater than 0.03% sulphur with Viscosity Index greater than or equal to 80 and less than 120. Used for finished lubricants depending on the properties.
500GR-1.appData: Base oils are being used for finished lubricants depending on the properties.

2500BRF.title: Stock 2500 BRF (150 BS) (GR I)
2500BRF.subTitle: Base Oil
2500BRF.description: Virgin Mineral base oil containing less than 90% saturates and/or greater than 0.03% sulphur with Viscosity Index greater than or equal to 80 and less than 120. Used for finished lubricants depending on the properties.
2500BRF.appData: Base oils are being used for finished lubricants depending on the properties.

75SM.title: 75 SM (GR II) LUBES
75SM.subTitle: Base Oil
75SM.description: Virgin Mineral base oil containing greater than or equal to 90% saturates and less than or equal to 0.03% sulphur with Viscosity Index greater than or equal to 80 and less than 120. Used for finished lubricants depending on the properties.
75SM.appData: Base oils are being used for finished lubricants depending on the properties.

150GR-2.title: 150 SN (GR II) LUBES
150GR-2.subTitle: Base Oil
150GR-2.description: Virgin Mineral base oil containing greater than or equal to 90% saturates and less than or equal to 0.03% sulphur with Viscosity Index greater than or equal to 80 and less than 120. Used for finished lubricants depending on the properties.
150GR-2.appData: Base oils are being used for finished lubricants depending on the properties.

500SN.title: 500 SN (GR II) LUBES
500SN.subTitle: Base Oil
500SN.description: Virgin Mineral base oil containing greater than or equal to 90% saturates and less than or equal to 0.03% sulphur with Viscosity Index greater than or equal to 80 and less than 120. Used for finished lubricants depending on the properties.
500SN.appData: Base oils are being used for finished lubricants depending on the properties.

CBFS.title: CBFS
CBFS.subTitle: SPECIALITY
CBFS.description: CBFS stands for Carbon Black Feedstock composition, rich in aromatics like naphthalene. There are two types of CBFS: High BMCI type and General type. BMCI (Bureau of Mines Co-relation Index) measures the degree yield of Carbon Black. The higher the number, the better the yield. Sulphur content in CBFS reduces the effect of BMCI value.
CBFS.appData: Primary use as a reinforcing agent in tires, belts, hoses, improving strength and wear resistance.

HYT-500.title: HYTHERM 500
HYT-500.subTitle: Thermic Fluid
HYT-500.description: The product is manufactured from petroleum stocks produced by special refining process in which the thermally unstable components are removed. HYTHERM 500 is recommended in service involving a maximum bulk oil temperature of 290°C. Benefits include excellent oxidation & chemical stability, good heat transfer properties, low volatility, and non-corrosive and non-toxic.
HYT-500.appData: All types of heat transfer applications. This grade finds extensive application in textile, pharmaceuticals, chemical, and processing industries.
HYT-500.industrial: Textile, Pharmaceuticals, Chemical and Processing Industries

HYT-600.title: HYTHERM 600
HYT-600.subTitle: Thermic Fluid
HYT-600.description: This grade is derived from the finest quality petroleum base stocks and is fortified with high-performance additives to enhance performance at higher temperatures. Features include: ability to provide superior performance in indirect closed fluid heat transfer systems up to 320°C, increased life, reduced oxidation and thermal degradation, minimal fouling and deposit formation, hence sustained heat transfer characteristics.
HYT-600.appData: All types of heat transfer applications. This grade finds extensive application in textile, pharmaceuticals, chemical and processing industries.
HYT-600.industrial: Textile, Pharmaceuticals, Chemical and Processing Industries

DEF.title: HP Diesel Exhaust Fluid (DEF)
DEF.subTitle: Motor Fuel / Lubes
DEF.description: DEF, most commonly refers to Diesel Exhaust Fluid, is a crucial non-toxic liquid (32.5% urea, 67.5% deionized water) used in modern diesel engines with Selective Catalytic Reduction (SCR) systems to convert harmful Nitrogen Oxides (NOx) into harmless nitrogen and water, meeting latest emission standards.
DEF.appData: HP DEF is recommended for modern Commercial Vehicles (Trucks & Buses), Diesel SUVs and any other BS IV / VI or Euro IV/V/VI compliant diesel engines employing SCR / EGR-SCR technology for NOx reduction.
alternatives: TATA MOTORS HP GENUINE DEF (Rebrand of HP DEF)

Lubricant.title: HP KISAN SHAKTI
Lubricant.subTitle: Agriculture Oils
Lubricant.description: HP KISAN SHAKTI is an engine oil developed for agricultural Pump-Sets running on Diesel, Kerosene or Light Diesel Oil (LDO). The product is made from paraffinic base stocks and fortified with select additives to deliver performance benefits in the pump-sets used in agriculture and farming activities. The superior additive chemistry not only ensures greater protection of the engine against wear and rust, its balanced detergency helps to keep the engine clean and trouble free for longer service intervals.
Lubricant.appData:
HP KISAN SHAKTI is recommended for all types of agricultural and farm equipment like Pumpsets, Tractors, Powertillers, Harvesters & DG sets requiring good quality Diesel Engine Oils. 
HP KISAN SHAKTI can also be used in petrol engines to render satisfactory performance.

HPGas.title: HP GAS (LPG)
HPGas.subTitle: Domestic / Commercial / Industrial Fuel / Free trade LPG
HPGas.description: HP GAS (LPG) is a clean, efficient, and high-calorific gaseous fuel comprising mainly of mixture of Propane (C₃H₈) and Butane (C₄H₁₀). It is colourless, odourless in natural form (odorized with Ethyl Mercaptan for safety), non-toxic. HP GAS is produced during petroleum refining and gas processing.

specifications.value: Propane / Butane mixture as per IS 4576

HPGas.appData: Cooking fuel (domestic & commercial), Industrial heating, drying & processing, Metal cutting & brazing, Fuel for LPG-based gensets, vaporizers & furnaces.
HPGas.industrial: Domestic households, Hotels & restaurants, Small & large industries, Commercial kitchens, Construction & fabrication units

HGFP.title: HP GAS FLAME PLUS
HGFP.subTitle: Commercial LPG
HGFP.description: HP GAS FLAME PLUS is LPG fortified with an additive to enhance the combustion properties of LPG. The additive increases the flame temperature and improves the combustion kinetics of propane/butane, resulting in quicker heating, reduced gas consumption, reduced process time, and more savings for the customers.
HGFP.appData: Hospitality (hotels, restaurants, canteens), bakeries, food processing, and various industries.
HGFP.industrial: Commercial use for heating and processing applications

TansformerOil.title: TRANSFORMER OIL
TansformerOil.subTitle: Transformer Oil
TansformerOil.description: Mineral insulating Oils for transformer and similat electrical equipment where normal oxidaton reristance is required. HP Transformeroil is designed for human safety and free from carcinogenic Polychlorinated Bi-Phenyls (PCB) and Poly aromatic hydrocarbon (PAH).
TansformerOil.appData: HP Transformer Oil is recommended for Electric Transformers,Switch gears,Circuit breakers which require insulating fluids having very high oxidation stability and excellent ageing properties resulting in long product life.

MV2.title: FO (MV2 Grade)
MV2.subTitle: INDUSTRIAL FUEL
MV2.description: Fuel oil is a dark viscous residual fuels obtained by blending mainly heavier components from crude distillation unit. It is generally consisted of heavy petroleum product. Efficiency and type of fuel oil widely varies depending on kinematic viscosity and sulphur content.
MV2.appData: LDO is known for its efficient combustion properties. This fuel is free flowing in nature. It is largely an industrial fuel. It finds extensive use in industries such as manufacturing, power generation, and heating systems. It is commonly used in boilers, furnaces, and other equipment that require a steady and controlled source of heat.
